headline: Arnold Aronson, Who Revitalized Saks in the ’80s, Is Dead at 85
abstract: He transformed a venerable retail chain with a “dowager image” by courting baby boomers, renovating its flagship store and expanding its national reach.
lead_paragraph: Arnold Aronson, a retailing executive best known for reviving the financial fortunes of Saks Fifth Avenue in the early 1980s, in part by appealing to a younger clientele, died on Tuesday at his home in Manhattan. He was 85.
